title: Getting randomly logged out of sites
content: I have recently updated to version 81.0.2 of Firefox, and have noticed that for some reason, twitter will randomly sign me out for no reason even if I don't sign out of the site when I close the tab, forcing me to sign back in every so often. Curiously, something similar happens with gmail, as it will make me sign in both of my email accounts, even though normally when I bring up the gmail website it usually just asks which account I wish to sign in to. I have not cleared my cookies in the last few days, nor my cache, so this shouldn't be happening. What exactly is happening here? I didn't have this problem in the previous version of Firefox. Can anyone help?
creator: Marc7

title: 浏览器下载了安装不了
content: 下载了，但是安装的时候，显示，无法载入您的firefox的配置文件，它可能已经丢失，或是无法访问。这个要怎么办。谢谢！
creator: hk19330216

title: Fixed
content: I would like to thank everyone who tried to help me with my problem of not being able to sign in to certain websites. I finally (through trial an error) found the problem to my situation. I had downloaded an app called "Privacy Badger". It would let me sign in to some of my sites. I simply went to my puzzle piece at the top right of the screen. I started checking my apps, one at a time. Privacy Badger was the culprit. I simply turned it off. Everything is working fine.
creator: marinearty63

title: Problems with syncing across devices
content: Since updating to Android version 81.1.4 (which I don't particularly like as the whole fabric of the app renders it more difficult to use) I have had problems syncing across my Windows 10 desktop, my Apple MacBook Pro (OS X 10.15.7) and Android phone. It is as if the last update to both Android and the Windows version of Firefox have destroyed the syncing process that previously existed. Trying to follow the prescribed process for syncing has also proven difficult to the point of frustration. I seek a clear set of the steps involved with explanations of the steps that appear to me to have been omitted by the Firefox cognoscenti so that I can achieve the synchronisation of passwords and bookmarks across platforms. To help understand where I am at in the process and what is going wrong, I have tried to sync devices and add devices by opening Firefox on my Windows desktop and logging into my account. From there I select Account settings-Sync settings-Connect another device. This opens a new tab (Connect another device that has a dialogue box with a 'Show code' button. Clicking on the button produces another dialogue box with a Q-Code displayed that is supposed to 'scan in the code from within Sync settings'. From there on I am lost. I cannot discern any Q-code viewer within the sync settings on my Android device and using my camera results in nothing but an image of the code. Can someone please help with a clear explanation of what I need to do to synchronise Firefox across my platforms and restore my faith in the browser that has served me well for about the past two decades? I have neither the time nor inclination to trawl through all the KB articles that appear somewhat related but prove simply to add to my frustration with the product.
creator: jackgeorge15

title: How to Show "Look Up" menu item in Firefox on Mac when alt-click/right-click a word?
content:
When I right click a word in either Chrome or Safari, it shows the Mac menu option called "Look Up" which I often use for searching dictionary meanings.

How can we do that in Firefox for Mac?
creator: stoikoviro

title: Passwords not syncing
content: I don't know why I can't find any help articles on this, I can't possibly be the only one. My firefox account is not syncing between my devices. I am logged in to my firefox account on all of my devices. I only have one account. I can save a password on one, but it does not save on my account and I am not able to retrieve it between devices. What is the point of syncing if I can't access my passwords on other accounts? And yes, I have sync turned on. Also, why does it not auto fill across devices when the password is saved?? It seems like a useless feature.
creator: jbunds

title: Downloads crash
content: Many downloads I do that are big in size always just Fail. I try with other internet browsers and they work perfectly fine. I tried resetting Firefox already and that didn't do anything. I also tried safe mode to see if it was any my add-ons. All to keep failing my files. It only happens with Firefox.
creator: jacobduran1212

title: Adobe Flash not working
content: I have windows 10 and already have the adobe flash but cannot access my KIZOA page because it requires Adobe Flash and there is NO little brick icon in the address space to click to ALLOW. What is wrong??? I REALLY need to get into this page to work on projects! What can I do??? THANKS!
creator: HappyTrailz

title: Logging into Gmail and Facebook
content: When I try to get to Gmail and Facebook, I always have to log in, even though "Save this Browser" is always selected. This causes a problem as I have to have my phone with me for two-step log-ins. This problem started about a month ago, and inquiries to Gmail and Facebook have all gone unanswered. When I do log in, I get a message "We noticed an unusual login from a device or location you don't usually use. Was this you?" This isn't a device I don't normally use, it is one I use most of the time. I don't understand why this is happening and what I can do about it.
creator: harveastman

title: www.wunderground.com
content: www.wunderground.com works on chrome but just hangs on firefox ... this is new in the last few days ...
creator: oldunclejosh

title: Duplicate Bookmark entries
content:
Win 7 Pro, 64-bit, FF 81.0.2, 32-bit.

It appears that FF will not permit me to enter a duplicate bookmark. However, there are times when I would like the same bookmark to appear in more that one location. Is there a way to do this?
creator: LesF

title: Error "No se ha conectado: Posible problema de seguridad" cuando quiero buscar a través de Google
content:
Cuando intento buscar algo por el buscador de Firefox que utiliza Google para buscar me salta el mensaje: No se ha conectado: Posible problema de seguridad

Firefox ha detectado una potencial amenaza de seguridad y no ha continuado a www.google.com porque este sitio web requiere una conexión segura. 

Y al ir a la sección de "Avanzado" dice esto:

Los sitios web prueban su identidad mediante certificados. Firefox no confía en este sitio porque utiliza un certificado que no es válido para www.google.com. El certificado solo es válido para los siguientes nombres: www.google.com.ar, *.google.com.ar, google.com.ar

Código de error: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER

Investigué pero no pude encontrar como arreglar este problema, vi que se pedia este texto asi que lo pongo acá por las dudas
